intro: Leucheria hieracioides, commonly known as the hairy willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and wet meadows. The plant features small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity.
